Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Marcos E. Lopez: Initial Appearance as to Luis Figueroa-Santana(4), Juan Morales-Reyes(7), Jose Colon-Cruz (13) held on 8/7/2013. Present: AUSA Alberto Lopez, Teresa Zapata, SAUSA Victor Acevedo and Cesar Rivera. Defendants were provided with copy of the Indictment and advised as to the charges and their rights. After reviewing the CJA-23 form filled by defendants, the Court deemed it appropriate to appoint counsel. Defendants will be represented by counsel. Defendants ordered temporarily detained pending hearings. Govt. request case to be unsealed. Arraignment/Detention set for 8/12/2013 at 3:30 PM in Courtroom 10 before US Magistrate Judge Marcos E. Lopez. (amr) (Entered: 08/08/2013)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Marcos E. Lopez: Initial Appearance/Detention as to Victor Crispin-Rodriguez held on 8/7/2013. Present: AUSA Alberto Lopez, Teresa Zapata, SAUSA Victor Acevedo and Cesar Rivera. Defendant was provided with copy of the Indictment and advised as to the charges and his rights. After reviewing the CJA-23 form filled by defendant, the Court deemed it appropriate to appoint counsel. Defendant will be represented by counsel. As to bail, the Court adopt the PTS report and set bail in the amount of $5,000.00 unsecured plus standard conditions of release. Govt. did not opposed to bail. Arraignment set for 8/21/2013 at 9:00 AM in Courtroom 10 before US Magistrate Judge Marcos E. Lopez. (amr) (Entered: 08/09/2013)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Marcos E. Lopez:Arraignment/Detention as to Juan Morales-Reyes (7) Count 1,2,3,4,5,6 held on 8/12/2013. Present: AUSA Victor Acevedo, Atty Guillermo Macari. Dft is UC. Defendant was found competent to understand the proceedings. He waived the reading of the indictment and entered a plea of not guilty as to count(s) 1,2,3,4,5,6. The parties will have 7 days for discovery and 14 days thereafter to file any motions.Case is referred to Judge Francisco A. Besosa for trial setting. As to bail, defense counsel informed that they had nothing to offer but reserve the right to reopen the hearing if evidence is available. The Court ordered defendant detained without bail. Order to issue. (Court Reporter FTR.)Hearing set for 03:30.Hearing held at 03:49.Hearing ended at 03:52.Interpreter Sonia Crescioni. (al) (Entered: 08/13/2013)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Marcos E. Lopez:Arraignment/Detention as to Felix Vazquez-Rodriguez (18) Count 1,2,3,4,5 held on 8/12/2013. Present: AUSA Victor Acevedo, Atty Victor Chico. Dft is UC. Defendant was found competent to understand the proceedings. He waived the reading of the indictment and entered a plea of not guilty as to count(s) 1,2,3,4,5. The parties will have 7 days for discovery and 14 days thereafter to file any motions. Case is referred to Judge Francisco A. Besosa for trial setting. Defense counsel argued for bail. Gvmt moved for detention. After hearing the parties the Court ordered defendant released with the following conditions: $5,000.00 unsecured, mental health treatment, drug testing and necessary treatment, deft's son to be interviewed as third party custodian if qualified by Probation Office deft shall reside with him and shall not enter any area of the indictment, all other standard conditions apply as well. Order to issue. (Court Reporter FTR.)Hearing set for 04:30.Hearing held at 04:49.Hearing ended at 05:02.Interpreter Sonia Crescioni. (al) Modified on 8/16/2013 re typo. (re). (Entered: 08/15/2013)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Marcos E. Lopez:Arraignment/Detention as to Edwin Ruiz-Guzman (29) Count 1,2,3,4,5 held on 8/12/2013. Present: AUSA Victor Acevedo, Atty Tomas Roman. Dft is UC. Defendant was found competent to understand the proceedings. He waived the reading of the indictment and entered a plea of not guilty as to count(s) 1,2,3,4,5. The parties will have 7 days for discovery and 14 days thereafter to file any motions.Case is referred to Judge Francisco A. Besosa for trial setting. Defense counsel argued for bail. Gvmt moved for detention. After hearing the parties the Court ordered defendant released under the following conditions: $5,000.00 from which $1,000.00 is cash or secured and the remaining $4,000.00 unsecured, drug testing and treatment as necessary, mental health evaluation and treatment, as an essential condition consensual partner to be interviewed by the Probation Office for appointment as third party custodian, if any concerns arises the court shall be informed about the matter and other alternatives through a motion, all other standard conditions of release apply. Order to issue. (Court Reporter FTR.)Hearing set for 04:30.Hearing held at 05:19.Hearing ended at 05:37 Interpreter Sonia Crescioni. (al) (Entered: 08/15/2013)

ORDER denying 136 Motion Requesting Bail Pending Trial as to Luis Figueroa- Santana (4): In addition to the fact that defendant has a prior conviction for murder and violations to the Weapons Law of Puerto Rico, according to the government's proffer of the evidence: (a) at least three witnesses identify this defendant -- who has been charged as a leader and enforcer of the drug trafficking organization -- as someone that routinely possessed firearms; (b) one witness identifies him as someone who participated in acts of violence at the drug point; (c) one witness has seen the defendant handling and preparing large quantities of heroin for further distribution. Even if it were the case that this defendant does not appear in any of the video recordings, the matters previously mentioned lead to the conclusion that the presumption of dangerousness to the community has not been rebutted and that there is no condition or combination of conditions of release that can reasonably assure the safety of the community. Signed by US Magistrate Judge Marcos E. Lopez on 10/26/13. (Lopez, Marcos) (Entered: 10/26/2013)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Marcos E. Lopez: Arraignment/Bail as to Jose Diaz- Vazquez (5) Count 1,2,3,4,5,6 held on 12/30/2013. Present SAUSA Max Perez, Atty. Jason Gonzalez and PO Emanuel Bravo. Defendant waived the reading of the Indictment and entered a plea of not guilty as to all counts. The Government has 7 days to produce discovery and the defense has 14 days thereafter to file motions. Case is referred to Judge Besosa for further proceedings. As to bail, defense counsel did not request bail since defendant is currently serving a term of imprisonment in another case. The Court ordered defendant detained on the basis of risk of flight and danger to the community. Minute Entry for proceedings held before Judge Francisco A. Besosa: Motion Hearing as to Luis Figueroa-Santana held on 4/2/2014 re 556 MOTION to Withdraw as Attorney by Francisco J. Adams-Quesada. Present were: AUSA Teresa Zapata and Atty. Francisco Adams. Defendant was also present assisted by the Court Interpreter. Upon being questioned by the Court, defendant indicated the reasons why he wants his lawyer changed and the expectations he has from counsel. Government informed that the plea offer tendered to defendant was final, all documents and information that defendant provided to counsel have been taken into consideration; no new offer will be tendered. After hearing the defendant, Mr. Adams and the Government, the Court allowed Mr. Adams to withdraw from the case. The Clerk was directed to appoint a new counsel from the CJA panel. Mr. Adams was instructed to provide all documents and discovery to new counsel. A status conference will scheduled once the new attorney is appointed. (Court Reporter Joe Reynosa.)Hearing set for 09:30.Hearing held at 09:31 .Hearing ended at 09:49. Interpreter Enith Valdes. (grf) (Entered: 04/02/2014)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before Judge Juan M. Perez-Gimenez: Further status conference as to Jaime Davila-Reyes held on April 2, 2014. AUSA Cesar S. Rivera- Giraud, and Lydia Lizarribar were present. Parties advised as to the status of this case. Counsel for the defendant requested additional time in order to discuss the proposed plea counteroffer with the high ranking officials at the U.S. Attorneys Office. The request was granted. Further status conference set for April 25, 2014 at 2:00 p.m. Ifa plea agreement is not reached, on this date, the Court will set all cases as to this defendant for jury trial. Status Conference set for 4/25/2014 10:00 AM in PG's Chambers before Judge Juan M. Perez-Gimenez. (Court Reporter Kelly Surina.)Hearing set for 10:00.Hearing held at 11:16.Hearing ended at 11:19. (om) (Entered: 04/02/2014)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before Chief Judge Aida M. Delgado-Colon: Change of Plea Hearing as to Jaime Davila-Reyes (1) held on 6/11/2015. Present: AUSA Cesar Rivera and defense counsel Lydia Lizarribar. Defendant assisted by Court Interpreter. Parties inform that the Suppression Hearing set for today will not be held, they have reached a plea agreement as to all three cases (CR. 09-0390-01, CR. 13-435 and CR. 13- 534). Both District Judges Carmen Cerezo and Francisco Besosa approve to the consolidation of the cases for plea/sentencing purposes. Therefore, CR. 13-435 (FAB) and CR. 13-534-05 (CCC) are to be consolidated with CR. 09-0390 for plea/sentencing purposes. The defendant is found competent to plea. The defendant is advised of the maximum penalties he is facing, his constitutional rights, consequences of waiving his constitutional rights and the applicable statutory guidelines. After hearing the parties, a plea of guilty is entered as to Count One (1). The Court orders the preparation of the Pre-Sentence Report. Defendant to remain under custody Sentencing Hearing set for 9/21/2015 at 10:00 AM in Courtroom 1 before Chief Judge Aida M. Delgado- Colon. (Court Reporter Diane Breaz.) Hearing set for 1:00 p.m. Hearing held at 2:50 p.m. Hearing ended at 4:00 p.m. Interpreter Enith Valdes. (sr) (E-mail to USPO). (Entered: 06/12/2015)

Defendant assisted by Court Interpreter. USPO Ariel Rivera also present. PSR to be amended accordingly to the changes ordered by the Court. Statements in support of mitigation of punishment heard on behalf of the defense. Defendant's allocution heard. Count(s) 1, One hundred and ninety two (192) months as to Count One in CR. 13-435-01 (ADC). This term is to be served concurrently to the 192 months imposed as to Counts One in CR. 09-0390-01 (ADC) and CR. 13-534-05 (ADC) but consecutively to the sixty (60) months imposed as to Count Six in CR. 13- 534. Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Bruce J. McGiverin: Preliminary Revocation Hearing as to Yamil Vargas-Santiago (12) held on 3/21/2018. Present: AUSA Teresa Zapata, AFPD Lauren Rosen. Defendant was U/C, present in court and assisted by a certified court interpreter. Defendant is contesting the allegations made by USPO re mandatory condition #1 and the last paragraph of Page #2 of the 1096 Motion. Defendant is admitting the rest of the SRT violations. Testimony of USPO Luis Santana was heard on behalf of the government. Cross-examination conducted. Government's Exhibits 1 and 2 admitted. Arguments presented by AUSA Zapata and AFPD Rosen. After hearing the parties, the Court found probable cause as to all the allegations contained in the motion, including Mandatory Condition #1 and last paragraph of Page 2. Matter referred to Judge Francisco A. Besosa for final revocation hearing. Government requested detention pending final revocation. Defense counsel is not moving for release. The Court granted government's motion and ordered defendant detained. (Court Reporter DCR / Courtroom 8.)Hearing set for 09:00.Hearing held at 10:54.Hearing ended at 11:16.Interpreter Hilda Gutierrez. (dv) (Entered: 03/28/2018)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Camille L. Velez-Rive: Arraignment/Bail as to Juan Velardo-Hernandez (3) Count 1,2,3,4,5,6 held on 6/25/2018. Present: AUSA Maria Montanez, Atty. Giovanni Canino USPO August Castro. Defendant was U/C, present in court and assisted by a certified court interpreter. Defendant was found competent to understand the proceedings. He waived the reading of the Indictment and entered a plea of not guilty as to all applicable counts. The Government has 7 days to produce discovery and the defense has 14 days thereafter to file motions. Case is referred to Judge Francisco A. Besosa for further proceedings. As to bail, government moved for detention. Defense counsel stated that at this time they had nothing to offer. The Court granted government's motion and ordered defendant detained without bail. Minute Entry for proceedings held before Judge Francisco A. Besosa: Status Conference as to Juan Velardo-Hernandez (3) held on 7/11/2018. Present: AUSA Cesar Rivera and Atty. Giovanni Canino. AUSA Rivera was instructed to find out from the USM and file a motion informing the Court. The Court made reference to the cases of Efrain Irizarry (Case No. 3:11-cr- 00231(FAB) and Pedro San Lucas (Case No. 3:12-cr-00413-20(FAB)) which were dismissed for speedy trial violation in accordance with the 6th Amendment.  Government informed that discovery packages were provided at the bail hearing, plea offer was tendered last week. Atty. Canino has met with AUSA Zapata (in charge of the case). Minute Entry for proceedings held before Judge Francisco A. Besosa: Status Conference as to Juan Velardo-Hernandez (3) held on 9/25/2018. Present: AUSA Teresa Zapata and Atty. Jason Gonzalez (in substitution of Atty. Canino). Government informed that inquiries with the USM have been made to ascertain why defendant was not arrested until 2018. Government's position is that the USM, once it received information as to the whereabouts of the defendant, they immediately went out to arrest him. Atty. Gonzalez stated that Atty. Canino is corroborating the information as to defendant's location during the time the indictment was filed and the time of the arrest. The possibility of defendant accompanying his sick daughter in the hospital during that time was discussed. AUSA Zapata indicated that a generous offer was tendered. Defendant has manifested his interest in pleading guilty if a possible speedy trial violation is not determined. Atty. Gonzalez requested 10 days for Atty. Canino to meet with AUSA Zapata. Government and defense counsel to meet by no later than 10/9/2018. A further Status Conference was set for 10/19/2018 at 09:00 AM in Courtroom 2 before Judge Francisco A. Besosa.
